main.name: Abian Torres Torres
main.description: Computer scientist and Junior Data Science with the passion of never stop learning. Currently focused on the application of artificial intelligence techniques in computer vision and natural language processing
main.bio: 24 years old man born in Tenerife. My passion for technology led me to study Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence. But from a personal perspective, my curiosity, creativity, and perseverance are my main tools to never stop learning. That is why I am open to not stop investigating other fields. In fact, one of my main goals is to dedicate myself to research in fields such as machine learning, computer vision and neuroscience to help make this a better world.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Skills in the design and implementation of artificial intelligence sytems using my knowledge as developer.

education.description: This degree allows the development of professions related to artificial intelligence, robotics, multimedia design, graphics and animation, game programming, virtual reality, industrial applications, network security, etc., in areas as diverse as software and services, products and systems, telecommunications, etc.

learning tools and developing practical algorithms to: Manage and program advanced tools for the creation of intelligent software based on programming languages ​​such as Python or R, through OpenCV for artificial vision, NLTK for natural language processing or TensorFlow for automatic learning, as well as automatic generation of plans in STRIPS. Design and implement an artificial cognitive architecture using cloud infrastructure and big data ecosystems. Design, develop and implement a system with the implication of artificial intelligence techniques, cloud computing and machine learning. Obtain the ability to integrate new artificial intelligence developments into existing computer systems capable of responding to current demand. Use programming interfaces to provide an artificial system with superior cognitive functions. Identify the factors that turn an artificial intelligence solution into a viable project at the business level, as well as obtain the skills for the direction and management of artificial intelligence projects and deep knowledge of the different business models. Work with computational models of perception in different modalities: vision and speech.

work.title: Business Intelligence Developer (External practices)
work.description: Use of technologies such as MongoDB, Express, NodeJS or Angular to build a data analytics web platform, from backend to frontend (MEAN Stack Development). Use of Pentaho Dashboard to generate graphics from which users could gain valuable knowledge about the business (Data visualization). Designing of database schemes and queries in MySQL and MongoDB (Data Warehouse environments).

work.title: Data Science (Online external practices)
work.description: Working with temporal series related to the student enrollment. Tools such as Pandas, Numpy, Sckit-learn, Seaborn or Matplotlib were useful to prepare and understand data (Data analysis and processing). Design and implementation of machine learning algorithms with the purpose of predicting the enrollment rate per study (Modeling, keras and Scikit-learn as tools). Analysis of the results to provide to the company valuable knowledge in order to improve enrollment statistics (Reporting).

projects.title: Forensic Deep Learning for Deep Fakes Detection
projects.category: Study that examines what performance can bring the combination of different characterization methods in a time-sequencing analysis using networks recurrent and convolutional neurons, verifying first-hand that the detection of deep fakes is not not a trivial problem.

projects.title: Simulation of autonomous vehicle systems
projects.category: Development of a software capable of integrate two levels of simulation for autonomous vehicles. In the low level, a ROS (Robot Operating System) stack was built to run vehicles in order to analyze their behavior in different environments designed with Gazebo. Then, data is sent to a second module in charge of perform a discrete event simulation to measure impact in a high level, such as economic cost.
